title: The Tuple Temple
story: Tuples are like lists, but immutable - once created, they can't be changed! They're perfect for storing data that shouldn't be modified, like coordinates, database records, or function return values.
instructions: Create a tuple `coordinates` with values (10, 20, 30). Create variables `x`, `y`, `z` by unpacking the tuple. Create a variable `tuple_length` with the length. Print x, y, z, and the length.
solutionHidden:
coordinates = (10, 20, 30)
x, y, z = coordinates
tuple_length = len(coordinates)
print(x)
print(y)
print(z)
print(tuple_length)

tests.description: Should print x, y, z, and length

hints.text: Create tuple with parentheses: my_tuple = (item1, item2, item3)
Unpack tuple into variables: a, b, c = my_tuple assigns each value
coordinates = (10, 20, 30), then x, y, z = coordinates, then tuple_length = len(coordinates)
